# Government Tender Announcement: Video Surveillance System Upgrade

### Project Summary
The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is issuing a request for proposals (RFP) to design, engineer, and deliver a tender-ready contract for the upgrade and replacement of the existing video surveillance system at the Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Centre (NAFC).

### Tender Details

- **Reference Number:** WS4496226889-Doc4566571218
- **Publication Date:** 2024-05-02
- **Tender Closing Date:** 2024-06-07T14:00:00
- **Amendment Number:** 4

### Project Scope
The project involves the replacement and improvement of the existing video surveillance system, comprising cameras, digital video recorders, and a user interface. This upgrade will enhance the security and monitoring capabilities at the NAFC.

### Tender Status
The tender is currently expired, and proposals are no longer being accepted. This announcement serves as an archive of the original tender details.

### Contracting Entity
- **Contracting Entity Name:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
- **Contact Information:**
  - Carlos Castillo Nieto, Carlos (SPAC/PSPC)
  - carlos.castillonieto@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

### Technical Criteria
Successful applicants will be selected based on their technical merit and price. The technical evaluation criteria will be based on theHighest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price.

### Regions of Opportunity
The project is located in Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada.

### Notice
The tender description is available upon request.

### Important
The request for proposals (RFP) was issued against Supply Arrangement E0225-150564 – Mechanical and Electrical Engineering Services SA, list for Newfoundland. Five firms qualified under the Electrical discipline for the province of Newfoundland were invited to participate in the tender process. They are CBCL Limited, Hatch Mott MacDonald, MCW Maricor, WSP Canada Inc., and Stantec Consulting Ltd. This information is provided as a reference for future similar projects.
